alert.note: Alert for Arco, Mud Lake Desert; Blackfoot Mountains; Eastern Magic Valley; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Lower Snake River Plain; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region; Shoshone, Lava Beds; Upper Snake River Plain (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 11:09PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms with winds over 40 mph and locally heavy rain will impact portions of southeastern Blaine, western Caribou, central Oneida, Bannock, south central Butte, Power, central Bonneville, northwestern Franklin, Bingham and northeastern Cassia Counties through MIDNIGHT MDT... At 1106 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lava Hot Springs to 8 miles northeast of Fort Hall Bannock Peak to 7 miles south of Cold Water Rest Area. Movement was north at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pocatello, Blackfoot, American Falls, Malad, McCammon, Lava Hot Springs, Swanlake, Neeley, Chesterfield Reservoir, Goshen, American Falls Reservoir, Chubbuck, Shelley, Aberdeen, Inkom, Downey, Firth, Arimo, Rockland and Juniper. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
